alert.note: Alert for Baldwin (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 11:05AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Alabama, including the following county, Baldwin. * WHEN...Until 215 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1103 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms moving onshore. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen over the past few hours. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gulf Shores, Orange Beach, Bon Secour, Fort Morgan, Gasque, Miflin, Gulf Highlands, Caswell and Josephine. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
